summary: Consumer reporting agencies collect vast amounts of information on people, such as their debt and work histories. They package the information into reports and sell it. We looked at inaccuracies in those reports, which can have real consequences—especially for job seekers or people who need credit. Government and industry representatives said errors can happen in several ways. For example, agencies might match data to the...
title: Consumer Reporting Agencies: CFPB Should Define Its Supervisory Expectations
